author: Cindy Clark
title: Oscars: The 10 best dressed

persons.name: fullscreen taraji p. henson dan macmedan
filmmagic fullscreen giuliana rancic steve granitz
wireimage fullscreen zuri hall frazer harrison

text:
So many waves, so many red lips. These ladies finished off awards season in high style.
1. Jessica Biel She topped our list at the Golden Globes, and she's wowing us yet again. Like, wow . We couldn't stop looking at Biel in her metallic Kaufman Franco gown. “I call it perfection,” her husband Justin Timberlake told E!. We tend to agree.
Giving Oscar a run for his money. (Photo: Jeff Kravitz, FilmMagic)
2. Emma Stone It was a winning look for one of the biggest stars of awards season. The best actress nominee for La La Land was Old Hollywood perfection in this glamorous, golden Givenchy gown. A swingy fringe adds to the drama, and her finger waves and red lips complete the Gatsby-esque look.
Stone's time to shine. (Photo: Dan MacMedan, USA TODAY NETWORK)
3. Ruth Negga The best actress nominee for Loving looked gorgeous and elegant in a long-sleeved Valentino gown. "It's beautiful and I love it," Negga told USA TODAY about her headband, and ethically sourced rubies. Her blue ribbon, which was seen on many stars, signified her support of the ACLU .
A classy act. (Photo: Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP)
4. Brie Larson That neckline. Those ruffles. This dress is sexy and chic and we want it in our closet, please.
We want this dress. (Photo: Frazer Harrison, Getty Images)
]
5. Hailee Steinfeld She stole the show in a dramatic Ralph & Russo gown. Embellished with soft florals, the look was fresh and delightful.
A red-carpet winner. (Photo: Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP)
6. Taraji P. Henson The Hidden Figures star looked like a classic screen siren in an off-the-shoulder Alberta Ferretti gown. A dazzling diamond necklace by Nirav Modi was the icing on the cake.
Everything about this look works. (Photo: Jordan Strauss/Invision/AP)
7. Octavia Spencer The best supporting actress nominee for Hidden Figures shined in a full and feathery Marchesa gown. Forevermark Diamonds topped off her fun, fabulous look.
A silver siren. (Photo: Jeff Kravitz, FilmMagic)
8. Viola Davis She was a winner even before she walked out onto that stage. Davis, who took home the Oscar for best supporting actress for her role in Fence s, looked radiant in a beautiful Armani Prive gown.
Winning all over the place. (Photo: Frazer Harrison, Getty Images)
9. Kirsten Dunst A dramatic shape makes Dunst’s Dior gown anything but your basic black dress. A shorter hemline shows off the Hidden Figures actress' shoes.
Dramatic in Dior. (Photo: Jeff Kravitz, FilmMagic)
10. Naomie Harris Who says you need to go the distance (hemline-wise, that is) for the Oscars? Harris' short white Calvin Klein By Appointment dress says party in the front and the back. And those yellow shoes? Pure perfection.
Harris is white hot in this stylish look. (Photo: Dan MacMedan-USA TODAY NETWORK)
